TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed AccessChecksLevelOption extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the level of access checking for an application, either at the process level only or at all levels, including component, interface, and method levels.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this enumeration in conjunction with the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ApplicationAccessControlAttribute> attribute.
[!code-cpp[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.enterpriseservi_7_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.enterpriseservi_7_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices_Security#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.enterpriseservi_7_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.EnterpriseServices.AccessChecksLevelOption Application = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Enables access checks only at the process level. No access checks are made at the component, interface, or method level.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.EnterpriseServices.AccessChecksLevelOption ApplicationComponent = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Enables access checks at every level on calls into the application.
